Body: Invitation updated. Attendees: No attendees listed
Invitation updated. Attendees: Alin Anca, ilya Budyak

What We've Learned Updated: As we saw during our session, when the client is installed, and the proxy is enabled, the client will take the configuration of the proxy and it will not communicate with the server.
When the proxy is disabled, the newly installed client will communicate with the server.
We found 2 workarounds for this issue:
1. to install the client without the proxy enabled. and after it is installed, to enable it.
2. to remove from /etc/epp/options.ini the line for the proxy and also the "cert.xxxxx..." file from the same folder. The client could communicate with the server after that.
Next Steps Updated: Alex to discuss the root cause with Robert and deliver a solution to us.
Steps to Reproduce Updated: Install an EPP client on a computer that has proxy installed.
